pullsbody: Without an action FxA now goes to sign in or register based on whether or not you've ever signed in. Since we have explicit sign in and register buttons we'd like to always go to sign in or register based on that choice.

pulltitle: Set html[dir][lang] based on locale (bug 1152819)
pullsbody:
Treat the `rtl` language as right-to-left, include it in the default list of languages.

I originally had some code to only add `rtl` to `l10n_init.languages` if you were on `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` but I think we always set `body[data-languages]` when zamboni is serving this so I just put it in the default.

pulltitle: Use default locale on undefined param (#1138558)
pullsbody:
The locale in the _transformLocale method in the l10n_init module will be set to "en-US" when the given param is undefined. Param will be undefined when the user removes all available languages in his content->languages browser preferences.

~~Replaced window.navigator.l10n.language with window.navigator.language or if this property is still undefined with "en-US" in getDirection method in l10n module, e.g. http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#navigatorlanguage.~~
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects
pull_commit_message:
Fix for some undefined variables (Bug #1138558)

Add validation of some variables which may be undefined if no browser language is set, regarding bug report #1138558.

pulltitle: split l10n.js into global part and AMD part, fall back to en-US if no locale file (bug 985552/1044195)
pullsbody:
## Split l10n.js into l10n_init.js and l10n.js

**The problem:**
- We had duplicate code being requested twice via l10n.js.
- l10n.js was being served by Zamboni (unminified) and it is also a part of our include.js bundle.
- Probably due to developer oversight or lack of a build tool.
- The l10n.js served outside the bundle wasn't minified either which makes things worse.
- The two modules don't rely one another at all in terms of sharing code.

**How they will split:**
- l10n_init.js initializes l10n by injecting generated locale script tag. This runs before our include.js is loaded. It is responsible for setting window.navigator.l10n. [See Zamboni serve it before include.js](https://github.com/mozilla/zamboni/blob/master/mkt/commonplace/templates/commonplace/index.html#L58). 
- l10n.js simply exposes gettext, ngettext, and getDirection functions. 
- We will have the build tool minify and copy l10n_init.js into the project's JS root as l10n.js, just as Zamboni would expect.
- There's also a bunch of refactoring and formatting as usual.
## Fall back to en-US if no locale file

**The problem:**
- If the locale file hasn't been generated for the user's detected locale, it'll 404
- With no locale file, window.navigator.l10n stays undefined

**Solution:**
- Add an `onerror` that sets window.navigator.l10n.language to en-US.
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects
pull_commit_message: split l10n.js into global part and AMD part, fall back to en-US if no locale file (bug 985552/1044195)

pulltitle: v1.8.0 fix and refactor scroll states using events (bug 986625)
pullsbody:
- add two events to builder: `builder--pre-render`, `builder-post-render`. These happen immediately before and Nunjucks rendering.
- add two events to navigation: `navigation--pop-state` (clicking back) and `navigation-pre-navigate` (clicking a link, before a new state is shifted)
- separate scroll state logic from navigation and have navigation require scroll_state
- some code clean up

Scroll logic:
- When navigating (clicking a link for `navigation-pre-navigate`), save the state and then set the scroll to 0 on `builder--post-render`.
- When popping (going back for `navigation--pop-state`), set the scroll to the saved state on `page.loaded`
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects
pull_commit_message: v1.8.0 fix and refactor scroll states using events (bug 986625)

pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects

pulltitle: Move interval so it applies to the popup created by login.js (bug 1124790)
pullsbody:
I've also removed the focus. This is mainly because from my testing focusing the window doesn't work unless the popup is in blocker exceptions.

Non-whitespace changes can be seen here: https://github.com/mozilla/marketplace-core-modules/pull/19/files?w=1

r? @mstriemer
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects

pullsbody: Return the OS info in capabilities for the OS X install instructions banner.
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects

pulltitle: Show status of skipped unittests
pullsbody:
I realised that `xtest` doesn't skip tests it just errors out and doesn't mention anything. I made it actually skip tests and show the output so we know we still have tests to fix.

![screenshot 2015-01-21 15 42 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/211578/5845743/39534158-a184-11e4-8683-4be110e4d197.png)
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects

pulltitle: Allow login window re-use for payments (1122792, 1122790)
pullsbody:
- Popup creation moved out to util.
- If `login.login()` is passed a window it uses it.
- Uses a feature added in the fireplace PR linked below to keep the splash screen showing for fxa_authorize so that whilst the window is open prior to launching payments or prior to closing it shows the splash screen.

See also: https://github.com/mozilla/fireplace/pull/924
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects
pull_commit_message: Allow login window re-use for payments (1122792, 1122790)

pulltitle: Allow login window re-use for payments (1122792, 1122790)
pullsbody:
- Popup creation moved out to util.
- If `login.login()` is passed a window it uses it.
- Uses a feature added in the fireplace PR linked below to keep the splash screen showing for fxa_authorize so that whilst the window is open prior to launching payments or prior to closing it shows the splash screen.

See also: https://github.com/mozilla/fireplace/pull/924

pulltitle: Refactor device_* methods (bug 1083592)
pullsbody:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1083592

This should be fully backwards-compatible, adding tests and a new 'device_formfactor' method. Will be used to remove duplicate code in fireplace's compatibility_filtering.js.
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects
pull_commit_message:
Refactor device_* methods (bug 1083592)

This should be fully backwards-compatible, adding tests and a new
'device_formfactor' method. Will be used to remove duplicate code
in fireplace's compatibility_filtering.js.

pulltitle: Handle FxA login locally with a different API host
pullsbody:
This allows logging in to zamboni running at http://localhost:2600 and using fireplace at http://localhost:8675 to handle FxA auth.

I'm not sure this is the right thing to do. It will prevent you from following the email link locally unfortunately. It might be better for zamboni to self-host the `/fxa-authorize` file for local login. I will try that tomorrow.
pull_repo_desc: Core JS modules for Firefox Marketplace frontend projects
pull_commit_message:
Handle FxA login locally with a different API host

This allows logging in to zamboni running at http://localhost:2600 and
using fireplace at http://localhost:8675 to handle FxA auth.
